bestBHT.bht: The parable of the sower teaches that the effect of preaching depends on the state of the hearer's heart. The sower remains the same and the seed remains the same, yet the outcome is different due to the different conditions of the soil. This highlights the need for a receptive and fertile heart to receive the word of God. The sower soweth the word, the word of life, truth, peace, reconciliation, faith, righteousness, and salvation found in and through Jesus Christ.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: The result is entirely different, the whole difference must lie in the soils, which mean the different states of the human heart.

The great general lesson held forth in this parable of the sower is, that however faithful the preacher, and how pure soever his message, the effect of the preaching of the word depends upon the state of the hearer's heart.
The sower is the same, and the seed is the same; while the result is entirely different.
Marvin Vincent: The sower soweth the word. More precise than either Matthew or Luke. Compare Matthew 13:19; Luke 8:11.
Philip Schaff: Mark 4:14. Peculiar to Mark, though involved in the other accounts.
Archibald T. Robertson: The sower soweth the word (ο σπειρων τον λογον σπειρε). Not put thus clearly and simply in Matthew 13:19 or Luke 8:11.
John Gill: The seed in the parable, before delivered, and which fell on different sorts of ground, is the word of God.

The word is the word of life and truth; the word of peace and reconciliation; the word of faith and righteousness; the word of salvation; the word which publishes and declares all these to be in and by Jesus Christ.

bhtAttempts.bht: The parable of the sower in Mark 4:14 teaches us that the result of preaching depends entirely on the state of the hearer's heart. The sower remains the same, and the seed remains the same, but the outcome varies due to the different conditions of the soil, representing the different states of the human heart. This reminds us of the importance of cultivating a receptive and fertile heart in order to receive and respond to the word of God. The sower soweth the word, the word of life, truth, peace, reconciliation, faith, righteousness, and salvation, all found in and through Jesus Christ.

The parable of the sower teaches that the effect of preaching depends on the state of the hearer's heart. The sower remains the same and the seed remains the same, yet the outcome is different due to the different conditions of the soil. This highlights the need for a receptive and fertile heart to receive the word of God. The sower soweth the word, the word of life, truth, peace, reconciliation, faith, righteousness, and salvation found in and through Jesus Christ.

The parable of the sower emphasizes that the effectiveness of preaching relies on the condition of the hearer's heart. While the sower and the seed are consistent, the varying outcomes result from the different states of the human heart. Thus, it is crucial for individuals to cultivate a receptive and fertile heart to receive the word of God. The sower soweth the word, which encompasses the word of life, truth, peace, reconciliation, faith, righteousness, and salvation, all brought by Jesus Christ.

In the parable of the sower, we learn that the effectiveness of preaching is determined by the state of the hearer's heart. The sower and the seed remain the same, with differing outcomes due to the conditions of the soil, symbolizing the state of the human heart. To fully embrace the word of God, it is paramount to cultivate a receptive and fertile heart. The sower soweth the word, representing the word of life, truth, peace, reconciliation, faith, righteousness, and salvation, revealed in Jesus Christ.

The parable of the sower teaches us that the effect of preaching depends on the condition of the hearer's heart. With the sower and the seed remaining the same, different outcomes arise from the various states of the human heart. Therefore, it is crucial for individuals to cultivate a receptive and fertile heart to receive the word of God. The sower soweth the word, encompassing the word of life, truth, peace, reconciliation, faith, righteousness, and salvation, present in Jesus Christ.
